conclusion: Analyze the flow paths step by step to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
Liquid from A flows downward and encounters a red bar.
The red bar directs the flow diagonally to the right.
Flow from A hits the brown bar.
The brown bar directs the flow to the left.
Liquid continues downward from A.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid from B flows downward and encounters the green bar.
The green bar directs the flow diagonally to the left.
Liquid from B flows directly downward.
Liquid from B enters container E.
Liquid from C flows downward and encounters the green bar.
The green bar directs the flow diagonally to the right.
Flow from C hits the purple bar.
The purple bar redirects the flow downward.
Liquid from C flows directly into container D.
Liquid from A flows into container E.
Liquid from B flows into container E.
Liquid from C flows into container D.
Final Answer: Liquid from A and B will flow into container E, while liquid from C will flow into container D.
